articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Myanmar President
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Myanmar President
Pyongyang, April 13 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, received a message of greeting from Thein Sein, president of Myanmar, on April 8.
					The message extended sincere and best wishes to Kim Jong Un and, through him, to the DPRK people on the occasion of the 101st birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					It wholeheartedly wished Kim Jong Un good health and happiness as well as the DPRK steady progress and prosperity.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets Juche Idea Followers
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Juche Idea Followers
Pyongyang, April 13 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, met and had a talk with visiting foreign guests at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Saturday.
					They are Vishwanath, director-general of the International Institute of the Juche Idea, and Harish Gupta, director general of the Asian Regional Institute of the Juche Idea, who are both directors of the International Institute of  Social Scientists, Chairman Ramon Jimenez Lopez and Secretary General Eleazar Rubio Aldaran of the Latin American Institute of the Juche Idea, Chairman of the National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea of Democratic Congo Lohekele Kalonda Andre, and Chairwoman of the Kim Jong Suk Womenâ€™s Union of Russia Elena Bavichi.

articles.title: Foreigners, Overseas Koreans Visit Kimjongilia Festival
articles.content:
Foreigners, Overseas Koreans Visit Kimjongilia Festival
Pyongyang, April 13 (KCNA) -- Foreigners and overseas Koreans visited the venue of the 15th Kimilsungia Festival now under way with splendor on the occasion of the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung (the Day of the Sun).
					Head of the Indonesian government cultural delegation Hari Untoro Dradjat said:
					
					We are fortunate to take part in the festival.
					
					Koreans presented to the festival beautiful flowers with ardent yearning for Kim Il Sung.
					
					Many units and personages of different countries also presented Kimilsungia. Watching flowers in praise of the great man, we could notice well the profound reverence of the Korean people and progressive mankind for him.
					
					Yang Hongzhun, general manager of the Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia Greenhouse in Hunchun, China, noted:
					
					The longer I see flowers, the more they look fascinating and beautiful.
					
					Ardent feelings of people who miss Kim Il Sung are reflected in flowers in full bloom.  Not only people in the homeland but many foreigners and overseas Koreans cultivated flowers of the sun with sincerity and displayed them in the festival. This shows how deeply people venerate him.
					
					It is only our homeland that holds the festival of the flower named after Kim Il Sung.
					
					The director general of a Dandong company of China said:
					
					I deem it a great honor to participate in the festival. Admirable, indeed, is the sincerity with which people in the homeland brought flowers of the sun into full bloom. I was deep touched to see an endless stream of visitors to the festival venue. It is a manifestation of boundless reverence for the peerlessly great man, I think.
					
					Kim Il Sung was the greatest man.

articles.title: Marathoners Lay Floral Basket before Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Marathoners Lay Floral Basket before Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
Pyongyang, April 13 (KCNA) -- The participants in the IAAF-26th Mangyongdae Prize Marathon laid a floral basket and bouquets before the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill here on Saturday on the occasion of the birth anniversary of Kim Il Sung and made bows.

articles.title: IIJI Director General, Secretary General Pay Tribute to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
IIJI Director General, Secretary General Pay Tribute to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
Pyongyang, April 13 (KCNA) -- Vishwanath, secretary general of the International Kim Il Sung Prize Council and the International Kim Jong Il Prize Council who is also director general of the International Institute of the Juche Idea, Kenichi Ogami, secretary general of the International Institute of the Juche Idea, and his party visited the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill on Saturday.
					They laid a floral basket and bunches of flowers before the statues in deep reverence for the peerlessly great men who made undying contributions to accomplishing the cause of global independence, before paying tribute to them.

articles.title: Foreign Crewmen Celebrate Kim Il Sung's Birth Anniversary
articles.content:
Foreign Crewmen Celebrate Kim Il Sung's Birth Anniversary
Pyongyang, April 13 (KCNA) -- Foreign crewmen held a meeting at Wonsan Port on Saturday on the occasion of the 101st birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					The participants laid a bouquet before the statue of the President in Wonsan City, Kangwon Province and made a bow.
					
					Present at the meeting were the captain and crewmen of the Panamanian-flagged ship.
					
					Speeches were made there.
					
					The speakers said world progressives are expressing deep reverence for the President, who performed undying feats for the era and history, on the occasion of his birth anniversary.
					
					Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il will always live as they clearly indicated the way to be followed by the Korean people and progressive mankind, they noted.
					
					The Korean people are dynamically advancing along the road of socialism as they are holding the dear respected Kim Jong Un, another great brilliant Songun commander, in high esteem, they said.
					
					They wished the Korean people greater successes in the struggle to build a thriving socialist nation and reunify the country under the leadership of Kim Jong Un.
					
					A letter to him was adopted at the meeting.

articles.title: Foreign Guests Arrive
articles.content:
Foreign Guests Arrive
Pyongyang, April 13 (KCNA) -- Debabrata Vishwanath, secretary general of the International Kim Il Sung Prize Council and the International Kim Jong Il Prize Council and director-general of the International Institute of the Juche Idea, arrived here on Friday to take part in celebrations of the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					Arriving here on the same day were Harish Gupta, director general of the Asian Regional Institute of the Juche Idea, and his party and the Indian delegation of Juche idea study organizations led by Renu Khanna.

articles.title: Visits
articles.content:
Visits
Pyongyang, April 13 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Foreign Ministry headed by Vice-Minister Kim Hyong Jun came back home Saturday after touring African countries.
					A friendship delegation of Changdok School led by Principal Kang Jun Ho left here on the same day to visit China.
					
					Arriving here on the same day were Kenichi Ogami, secretary general of the International Institute of the Juche Idea, and his party.
					
					Leaving for home on the same day were the Indonesian government cultural delegation led by Hari Untoro Dradjat, expert senior staff to the minister of Tourism and Creative Economy, and the delegation of the Japan-Korea Society for Scientific and Educational Interchange led by Chairman Kenki Nakamura.

articles.title: Floral Basket, Congratulatory Letter to Kim Jong Un from Diplomatic Corps
articles.content:
Floral Basket, Congratulatory Letter to Kim Jong Un from Diplomatic Corps
Pyongyang, April 13 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un received a floral basket and a congratulatory letter from the diplomatic corps here on the occasion of the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung and the first anniversary of Kim Jong Un's election as first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					Upon the authorization Cuban Ambassador German Hermin Ferras Alvarez handed them to DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Saturday.

articles.title: Floral Basket, Gift to Kim Jong Un from Chairman of Korean Friendship Association
articles.content:
Floral Basket, Gift to Kim Jong Un from Chairman of Korean Friendship Association
Pyongyang, April 13 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un received a floral basket and a gift presented by Alejandro Cao de Benos, chairman of the Korean Friendship Association headquartered in Spain, on a visit to the DPRK to celebrate the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung (the Day of the Sun).
					The floral basket and gift were conveyed to an official concerned by the chairman on Friday.
					
					Meanwhile, a gift presented to Kim Jong Un by a representative of the French Branch of the association was conveyed to an official concerned on the same day.

articles.title: Floral Baskets Sent to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il by Int'l Organization
articles.content:
Floral Baskets Sent to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il by Int'l Organization
Pyongyang, April 13 (KCNA) -- Floral baskets were sent to the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill by the Women's International Democratic Federation and its president Marcia de Campos Pereira on the occasion of the birth anniversary of Kim Il Sung.
					The floral baskets were laid before the statues on Saturday.

articles.title: Floral Basket to Kim Jong Un from IIJI Secretary General
articles.content:
Floral Basket to Kim Jong Un from IIJI Secretary General
Pyongyang, April 13 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un received a floral basket from Kenichi Ogami, secretary general of the International Institute of the Juche Idea, and his party on the occasion of the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung (the Day of the Sun).
					The secretary general handed it over to an official concerned on Saturday.

articles.title: Floral Basket to Kim Jong Un from Japanese Figure
articles.content:
Floral Basket to Kim Jong Un from Japanese Figure
Pyongyang, April 13 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un received a floral basket presented by Takashi Nada, representative of the Ehime Institute for Contemporary Korean Issue in Japan, Saturday on the occasion of the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Sends Educational Aid Fund and Stipends for Education of Korean Children in Japan
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Sends Educational Aid Fund and Stipends for Education of Korean Children in Japan
Pyongyang, April 13 (KCNA) -- The respected Marshal Kim Jong Un sent educational aid fund and stipends amounting to 198.3 million yen to the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan on the occasion of the 101st anniversary of the birth of President Kim Il Sung for the democratic national education of children of Koreans in Japan.
					The educational aid fund and stipends sent by President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un on 159 installments so far total 47,123,350,390 yen.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Sends Birthday Spread to Centenarian
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Sends Birthday Spread to Centenarian
Pyongyang, April 13 (KCNA) -- A birthday spread sent by the dear respected Marshal Kim Jong Un was conveyed to woman centenarian Ri Ul Rim residing in Ryonbong-dong No. 1 in Hyesan City, Ryanggang Province.
					She was subject to maltreatment and insult as a member of the stateless nation before the country's liberation. She could lead a worthy life only after President Kim Il Sung liberated the country.
					
					She worked hard, prompted by her single desire to repay even a bit the loving care shown by the Workers' Party of Korea for her. Even after becoming a pensioner, she did a lot of good things such as giving help builders of revolutionary sites and revolutionary battle sites.
					
					She likes wild vegetables, in particular. She always leads an optimistic life, keeping herself busy cooking and cultivating family plot.

articles.title: Performance Given by Mansudae Art Troupe
articles.content:
Serformance Given by Mansudae Art Troupe
Pyongyang, April 13 (KCNA) -- The Mansudae Art Troupe gave a song and dance performance "Fortune of Korea" at the East Pyongyang Grand Theatre on Saturday to celebrate the first anniversaries of Kim Jong Un's election at the top posts of the Workers' Party of Korea and the state.
					Among the audience were Kim Yong Nam, Pak Pong Ju, the chairperson of a friendly party, officials of party, armed forces and power organs, public organizations, ministries and national institutions, service personnel of the Korean People's Army and the Korean People's Internal Security Forces and Pyongyangites.
					
					Present there on invitation were delegations of overseas Koreans and other compatriots, the chief of the Pyongyang mission of the Anti-Imperialist National Democratic Front, diplomatic envoys of different countries and representatives of missions of international organizations and military attaches in foreign embassies here and their spouses and other foreigners.
					
					The performance began with chorus "Fortune of Korea". Put on the stage were colorful numbers such as mixed duet and chorus "Our Leader Loved by People", female sextet "Man to Whom We Entrust Destiny and Future" and chorus "People Are United in Single Mind".
					
					The performers sang high praises of the undying feats of the dear respected Kim Jong Un, who is leading to victory the drive for accomplishing the revolutionary cause of Juche with rare wisdom, distinguished leadership ability and deep benevolence.
					
					Female trio "Song of People Blessed", male solo "Song of Sea" and other numbers vividly represented the people enjoying a happy life under the care of Kim Jong Un, who is taking warm care of all service personnel and people.

articles.title: Members of AINDF Pyongyang Mission Visit Kimilsungia Festival
articles.content:
Members of AINDF Pyongyang Mission Visit Kimilsungia Festival
Pyongyang, April 13 (KCNA) -- Jo Il Min, chief of the Pyongyang mission of the Anti-Imperialist National Democratic Front (AINDF), and its members visited the venue of the 15th Kimilsungia Festival on Saturday on the occasion of the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					They went round the venue of the festival which presents fantastic scenery with immortal flowers in full bloom thanks to profound reverence of all Korean people and the world progressives for Kim Il Sung.
					
					At the end of the visit the chief said:
					
					The Kimilsungia festival is being held with splendor every year to praise Kim Il Sung.
					
					The festival reflects the boundless reverence of the people for him.
					
					Kimilsungia will come into full bloom across the world.
					
					The vanguard fighters of the AINDF will wage a courageous struggle for national reunification, guided by the idea of "By our nation itself", holding the dear respected Marshal Kim Jong Un in high esteem.

articles.title: Participants in People's Festival Visit Mangyongdae
articles.content:
Participants in People's Festival Visit Mangyongdae
Pyongyang, April 13 (KCNA) -- The participants in the Third April Spring People's Festival visited Mangyongdae, the birthplace of President Kim Il Sung, on Saturday.
					They laid bouquets and flowers before the graves of Kim Po Hyon and Ri Po Ik, the President's grandparents, and Kim Hyong Jik and Kang Pan Sok, the President's parents, and observed a moment's silence in their memory.
					
					At the Mangyongdae Revolutionary Museum, they were briefed on the noble lives of the President, who devoted his all to the country and people, and his patriotic and revolutionary family members. They went round mementoes and historic relics on display there.
					
					Going round the historic relics preserved with care at the thatch-roofed house in Mangyongdae, they deeply grasped the immortal exploits the President performed for the times and history after embarking upon the road of revolution in his early years and his revolutionary career totally dedicated to the people's happiness.
					
					They also visited revolutionary sites on Mangyong Hill.

articles.title: Delegation of Koreans in Japan Visits Mangyongdae
articles.content:
Delegation of Koreans in Japan Visits Mangyongdae
Pyongyang, April 13 (KCNA) -- A delegation of Koreans in Japan headed by Ri Ki Sok, advisor to the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon), visited Mangyongdae, the birthplace of President Kim Il Sung. It came here to celebrate the birth anniversary of the President (the Day of the Sun).
					The members of the delegation visited the old home of the President with deep reverence for him. They went round historic relics with keen interest, being briefed on the immortal story about this historic home.
					
					They had a picture taken before the old home in Mangyongdae.
					
					At the end of the visit the head of the delegation said:
					
					Visiting the old home in Mangyongdae, we miss Generalissimo Kim Il Sung very much.
					
					He made a great contribution to developing Chongryon and the movement of Koreans in Japan.
					
					I always remember the loving care shown by him for the Koreans in Japan.
					
					I will remain loyal to the idea and leadership of the dear respected Marshal Kim Jong Un, bearing deep in mind the behests of the great Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Second-Day Performances of April Spring People's Art Festival Given
articles.content:
Second-Day Performances of April Spring People's Art Festival Given
Pyongyang, April 13 (KCNA) -- The second-day performances of the Third April Spring People's Art Festival were given at theatres, music halls and cultural houses here Saturday.
					Among the audience were people, youth and students in the city.
					
					Performances were given by art troupes at the Pyongyang Grand Theater, Moranbong Theater, Central Youth Hall and Music Hall of the Pyongyang Kim Won Gyun Conservatory.
					
					The performers sang high praise of the revolutionary life and immortal feats of the Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il who provided the eternal foundation for prosperity of the sun's nation on this land, and the leadership art of the dear respected Marshal Kim Jong Un who is glorifying the cause of the sun under the uplifted banner of Songun.
					
					Overseas Korean artistes conspicuously decorated the festival stage with songs and dances.
					
					Artistes of South Hwanghae and Jagang provinces and Kaesong City presented their peculiar repertoires.
					
					Members of art squads and itinerant art squads gave performances at the National Theatre and the Yun I Sang Concert Hall.
					
					In their numbers such as female chorus "Our Leader Unforgettable", mixed chorus "Do Prosper, Era of the Workers' Party", members of the art squad of the Ministry of Railways made a successful artistic depiction of the immortal feats of the great sages of revolution who dedicated themselves to the people's happiness and the prosperity of the generations to come all their lives.
					
					Members of art squads of the central committees of the Korean Democratic Women's Union and the Union of Agricultural Workers put on the stage dialogic poem "Wish and Blessing", guitar assemble "Everything Goes Well Only When a Family Is in Harmony" and  female chorus "Song of Plowing".
					
					Members of art groups from across the country presented their performances at the stages of the Pyongyang International Cinema House, Cultural House of the Ministry of Railways, Central House of Workers and Central Youth Hall, revving up the atmosphere of the festival. 
					
					The festival continues.

articles.title: Doctorate of Socio-Political Science Awarded to Kim Jong Un
articles.content:
Doctorate of Socio-Political Science Awarded to Kim Jong Un
Pyongyang, April 13 (KCNA) -- Doctorate of socio-political science was awarded to the dear respected Kim Jong Un by the International Institute of Social Scientists on the occasion of the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung. 
					A ceremony of conveying the title took place at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Saturday.
					
					Present there were Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Ri Yong Sik and Ri Yong Chol, vice department directors of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea, Ri Hye Jong, director of the Academy of Social Sciences, Kim Jin Bom, vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, Ji Sung Chol, vice-director of the Academy of Social Sciences, and officials concerned.
					
					Also present there were Director General of the International Institute of the Juche Idea Vishwanath and Director General of the Asian Regional Institute of the Juche Idea Harish Gupta who are directors of the International Institute of Social Scientists, Chairman of the Latin American Institute of the Juche Idea Ramon Jimenez Lopez and Secretary General Eleazar Rubio Aldaran, Chairman of the National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea of Democratic Congo Lohekele Kalonda Andre, Chairwoman of the Kim Jong  Suk Womenâ€™s Union of Russia Elena Bavichi, delegations and delegates of Juche idea study organizations.
					
					Vishwanath made a speech.
					
					He said Kim Jong Un is devoting himself to building a thriving socialist nation with his extraordinary political ability, distinguished leadership and noble traits true to the idea and intention of Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il, . He added:
					
					The Council of the International Institute of Social Scientists decided to award title No. 1 of doctor of socio-political science to Kim Jong Un.
					
					A decision of the council and certificate of doctor were read out at the ceremony.
					
					Vishwanath handed over to President Kim Yong Nam the certificate, gold medal, cup and the decision of the council awarded to Kim Jong Un.
					
					Ramon Jimenez Lopez made a congratulatory speech on behalf of the followers of the Juche idea in Latin America, Lohekele Kalonda Andre on behalf of the followers of the Juche idea in Africa and Elena Bavichi on behalf of the followers of the Juche idea in the eastern European region.
					
					Ramon Jimenez Lopez said that Kim Jong Un has vigorously encouraged the world progressive people in their struggle for realizing independence.
					
					Lohekele Kalonda Andre said that Kim Jong Un is wisely guiding the work of all fields with his veteran and seasoned leadership.
					
					Elena Bavichi expressed belief that the Korean people would foil the U.S. imperialists and their allies' moves for aggression and successfully build a reunified thriving nation under the leadership of Kim Jong Un.
					
					Kim Yong Nam noted that the awarding of the title to Kim Jong Un is an expression of progressive mankind's profound reverence for him.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Outlook on Happiness
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Outlook on Happiness
Pyongyang, April 13 (KCNA) -- President Kim Il Sung was a great sage with a lofty outlook on happiness.
					In his lifetime, he would say that he was blessed with good people, comrades and the great heir.
					
					He called the Korean people the heroic people who wrought miracles in the revolution and construction, remaining faithful to their leader.
					
					In April Juche 82 (1993) he was asked about his hobby by Washington Times. He answered that his hobby was to find himself among the popular masses. His remarks deeply moved its journalists.
					
					Kim Il Sung had so many comrades who shared with him the same idea and will, and weal and woe.
					
					He took it as his belief that gaining comrade is to win everything but losing comrade is to lose everything. He was always grateful to his comrades.
					
					Unprecedented in history, his comradeship reached even many foreigners, among them being Zhang Weihua, a Chinese anti-Japanese revolutionary martyr, and Ya. T. Nobichenko, a Russian military officer who covered the explosion of a hand grenade with his body.
					
					He was also very proud of being blessed with the great heir. This pride was clearly expressed in the poem "Shining Star" which he personally composed on leader Kim Jong Il's 50th birthday.
					
					When an opportunity presented itself, he used to mention Kim Jong Il's greatness.
					
					Indeed, the three kinds of blessings were what could be enjoyed only by Kim Il Sung, the eternal sun of mankind.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung Enjoys Birthdays among People
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung Enjoys Birthdays among People
Pyongyang, April 13 (KCNA) -- With the approach of the Day of the Sun (April 15), President Kim Il Sung's birthday, the Korean people are sorely missing him, who spent most of his birthdays on the job to ensure the wellbeing of the people.
					It was one day in the period of the Fatherland Liberation War (June 1950-July 1953) when officials were preparing birthday food for him.
					
					After knowing the fact, he rebuked officials for the preparation, saying:
					
					Born into a poor peasant family, I have never enjoyed my birthday until now, always finding myself busy with my revolutionary activities. Enjoying birthday is not suitable to my way of life.
					
					Moreover, the present situation does not allow me to do it. We only have to think of how we can defeat the U.S. aggressors in the war. I will gladly enjoy my birthday after we win the war.
					
					Then, he asked officials to send a chicken and some eggs they brought for his birthday meal to a nearby medical post, and took boiled rice and cereals and pickles of edible herbs only.
					
					On April 15, 1954, Kim Il Sung gave field guidance to the Samjong Agricultural Cooperative in Junghwa County. 
					
					While having talks with farmers on an edge of barley field early in the morning, he heard one of them saying there was a quality spring near a village. Immediately, he made his way to the spring. He stepped into a marshland and personally selected a site for building a fish breeding ground.
					
					He visited several other units that day. Upon returning from the field guidance, he said:
					
					I enjoyed my birthday today with pleasure. I think enjoying birthday does not mean taking good food and rest. For me, it is a rest to see everything going well in the country.
					
					On April 15, Juche 77 (1988), he came to his office immediately after appreciating a joint performance of foreign artistes who participated in the April Spring Friendship Art Festival.
					
					He called on an official to take a measure to recondition equipment of the Pukchang Thermal Power Complex. Then, he took a step to operate the Sunchon Cement Complex at full capacity, before giving instructions concerning steel and electricity output.
					
					Earnestly requested to take some rest that day, his birthday, he said he was willing to do more work before he became older. He then continued to deal with state affairs until late at night.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung, Ever-victorious Illustrious Commander
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung, Ever-victorious Illustrious Commander
Pyongyang, April 13 (KCNA) -- Twenty-one years has elapsed since the title of DPRK generalissimo was awarded to President Kim Il Sung on the occasion of his 80th birthday.
					On this anniversary, the Korean army and people recall with deep emotion the enduring feats Kim Il Sung performed by leading the Korean revolution to victory with arms.
					
					He led to victory the two-decade anti-Japanese struggle and the three-year war with the U.S. imperialists.
					
					With two pistols bequeathed by his father as an asset, he founded the Korean People's Revolutionary Army and began fighting against the one million-strong Japanese army to liberate Korea from Japan's colonial rule.
					
					After the country' liberation, he founded the Korean People's Army and led the Fatherland Liberation War (1950-1953) to victory, thus bringing about the beginning of downhill turn for U.S. imperialism for the first time in history.
					
					He made big contributions to bringing to naught the "crusade expedition of the 20th century", launched by the imperialist allied forces, and defended the nation's dignity and sovereignty with arms, which encouraged the world's progressives in their struggle for independence against imperialism.
					
					Kim Il Sung was, indeed, an ever-victorious illustrious commander.

articles.title: U.S. Is to Blame for Escalating Tension on Korean Peninsula: KCNA Commentary
articles.content:
U.S. Is to Blame for Escalating Tension on Korean Peninsula: KCNA Commentary
Pyongyang, April 13 (KCNA) -- The U.S. warmongers dispatched super-large nuclear-powered carriers Nimitz and Stennis to waters adjacent to the Korean Peninsula, claiming that they are to cope with "provocations" from the DPRK. In the wake of this dispatch, they let nuclear submarine Cheyenne operate in waters off the vicinity of the peninsula, revving up the war atmosphere to an extreme pitch.
					The U.S. has staged nuclear war maneuvers for decades but it is something unprecedented that all type nuclear strike means are involved in the saber-rattling to stifle the DPRK.
					
					All facts go to prove that the U.S. scenario to ignite a nuclear war in Korea has reached an extremely dangerous phase.
					
					The worst situation is now prevailing on the peninsula due to the U.S. desperate moves for a nuclear war.
					
					The U.S. is to wholly blame for this tension on the peninsula. 
					
					The U.S. is making desperate efforts to force the DPRK to dismantle its nukes at any cost from the judgment that the latter's acquisition of tremendous military capability would bring it a total failure in its hostile policy toward Pyongyang as it is directly linked with its strategy for dominating the world.
					
					The U.S. prodded the UN into fabricating its "resolutions" on harsh sanctions against the DPRK over its satellite launch in last December and third underground nuclear test in February this year. It is now busy staging unprecedentedly large DPRK-targeted war drills.
					
					It worked out even a "plan for jointly coping with provocation of a local war" together with south Korean puppet forces, openly revealing its ulterior aim to develop the war to be preempted by the south Korean army into an all-out nuclear war against the DPRK with huge U.S. forces involved.
					
					The U.S. moves to stifle the DPRK have reached their height in their vicious and desperate nature as its all political, economic and military potentials are mobilized.
					
					All facts show that it is none other than the U.S. which created such touch-and-go situation in Korea. 
					
					By shifting its responsibility for the tension on the peninsula on to the DPRK, the U.S. seeks to bring international pressure upon the DPRK and justify its heinous hostile policy toward the latter. 
					
					With no intrigues, however, can the U.S. break the will of the army and people of the DPRK to win in confrontation with the former.
					
					The DPRK's toughest countermeasures for self-defense against the U.S. acts of disturbing peace and stability in the region are just and they are sure to triumph.
					
					The army and people of the DPRK will continue intensifying their counteractions to put a definite end to the U.S. vicious hostile policy toward the DPRK.
					
					The U.S. would be well advised to bear in mind that it would not be safe in face of the army and people of the DPRK all out to punish it with nukes of justice.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Denounces S. Korean Large-Scale Joint Firepower Drills
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Denounces S. Korean Large-Scale Joint Firepower Drills
Pyongyang, April 13 (KCNA) -- The south Korean warmongers waged large-scale joint firepower drills against the DPRK on April 9 along the east coast of south Korean Kangwon Province with K-9 SPG, MLRS, anti-artillery radar, destroyers, KF-16 and F-15K and other war equipment of the three services involved.
					With the Foal Eagle joint military exercises now in full swing, the puppet forces staged large-scale saber-rattling against the DPRK with the three services involved. This is a dangerous move to escalate tension, says Rodong Sinmun Saturday in a bylined commentary.
					
					It goes on:
					
					The situation on the Korean Peninsula has never been so tense and dangerous as now.
					
					The puppet forces, regarding the present situation prevailing on the peninsula as a golden opportunity for realizing their failed ambition for invading the north, are staging the provocative saber-ratting in collusion with their master U.S. imperialists on a daily basis.
					
					The puppet warmongers claimed that the saber-rattling is aimed to cope with the "provocation from the north".
					
					But, the story about "provocation from the north" touted by them is sheer sophism profoundly confusing right and wrong.
					
					The outbreak of a nuclear war on the peninsula has now become a fait accompli owing to the U.S. and the south Korean puppet forces. Therefore, it is natural for the DPRK to move to the actual military action to resolutely foil the enemies' vicious aggression attempts by mobilizing the deterrent for self-defence.
					
					There will be no mercy in an all-out action to end their reckless military threat and aggression, firmly defend the country's sovereignty and supreme dignity and achieve the historic cause of national reunification.
					
					If the enemies dare provoke the DPRK while going reckless, it will immediately blow them up with an annihilating strike with the use of powerful nuclear means.

articles.title: Russia, China to Jointly Cope with U.S. Military Strategy: News Analyst
articles.content:
Russia, China to Jointly Cope with U.S. Military Strategy: News Analyst
Pyongyang, April 13 (KCNA) -- As the U.S. pivot-to-Asia-Pacific strategy has entered the phase of its implementation, Russia and China are jointly reacting to it, drawing the world's attention.
					The U.S. deputy secretary of Defense underscored the need to transfer more forces to the Asia-Pacific region as the defence pivot is shifting to that region. He clarified that 60 percent of the U.S. naval force, in particular, would be deployed in the region by 2020.
					
					Russian Vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs Sergei Lyavkov said the U.S. announcement that it would give up the fourth phase of the European missile shield does not mean a concession made to Russia.
					
					The Chinese newspaper Huan Qiu Shibao commented the U.S. efforts to tighten the military alliance in the Asian-Pacific region are aimed at keeping controlling its traditional allies in that region and preparing for a new Cold War with China.
					
					Under the prevailing situation the military cooperation between Russia and China for jointly coping with the U.S. strategy is entering a full-fledged stage.
					
					A typical example of this was Chinese President Xi Jinping's visit to Russia in March last.
					
					The heads of the two countries emphasized at the talks that the two countries could not allow their strategic stability and security to be affected by the unilateral and limitless expansion of the missile shields, the U.S. in mind. They agreed upon jointly coping with the U.S. military threat.
					
					A Chinese military delegation during its visit to Russia watched a computer simulation test that showed how the realization of the U.S. plan for missile shield will affect the regional and strategic stability and expressed its will to develop dialogue with Russia in missile defense field. 
					
					An agreement was signed between the two countries on Russia's supply of 24 Cy-35 fighters to China and the joint building of four Lada-class diesel-powered submarines. 
					
					Analysts paid attention to the fact that Xi Jinping was the first foreign head of state who visited the Russian Ministry of Defense and the operation control centre of the federal armed forces, adding that cooperation between Russia and China in the military field was making rapid progress. 
					
					AFP also commented that Russia and China were getting closer with each other in the course of jointly coping with the hegemony of the U.S.
					
					Foreign media predict that the contradiction and friction will grow deep between the two countries and the U.S. as the U.S. moves for military domination over the Asian-Pacific region will be evermore undisguised in the days ahead.

articles.title: S. Korean Regime Responsible for KIZ Crisis
articles.content:
S. Korean Regime Responsible for KIZ Crisis
Pyongyang, April 13 (KCNA) -- The south Korean conservative regime seeks to reduce the Kaesong Industrial Zone (KIZ), a product of the June 15 joint declaration, to a theatre of confrontation, not content with having militarily strained the situation on the Korean Peninsula.
					"Defense Minister" Kim Kwan Jin of south Korea revealed a sinister intention to introduce a U.S. special unit into KIZ, vociferating about an operation for "rescuing hostages".
					
					In this regard, the DPRK Monday declared an important step of withdrawing all its employees from KIZ and temporarily suspending the operations in the zone. This is a decisive and just measure under the present situation.
					
					However, the south Korean war maniacs are running riot to buck the blame for the suspension onto the DPRK, with the chief of Chongwadae spinning out shameless remarks.
					
					By nature, KIZ was built thanks to the DPRK's special favors, with many south Korean businesses benefiting from the zone.
					
					During the Lee Myung Bak's office of four years in south Korea, the DPRK had ensured KIZ's full operation although series of knotty problems came up in the zone. This was prompted by an aim to speed up cooperation and exchange between the north and south, based on the idea of "By our nation itself".
					
					But Lee alleged that the KIZ operation gives benefits only to the north. And he dubbed the north-south economic cooperation "drain on resources" for the north, saying that "cooperation will not help improve the south-north relations".
					
					Ri Song Hwa, a Pyongyang citizen, said:
					
					"The present chief executive of south Korea should take a right option. The responsibility for the suspension of the KIZ operation rests entirely with the south Korean authorities."

articles.title: U.S. Seeks to Ignite Nuclear War in Korea
articles.content:
U.S. Seeks to Ignite Nuclear War in Korea
Pyongyang, April 13 (KCNA) -- The Korean Peninsula is now on the brink of a nuclear war owing to the DPRK-targeted nuclear war exercises launched by the U.S. and south Korean forces.
					The U.S. and south Korean forces openly claimed that the ongoing Foal Eagle joint military drill involves armed forces with higher war performance capabilities than previous years.
					
					A "B-2A" bomber of the U.S. flew to the sky above south Korea to make a mock-up exercise for nuclear bomb dropping. And Aegis destroyers, John S. McCain and Decatur, and sea-based radar SBX-1 were dispatched to waters off south Korea.
					
					Such reinforcement clearly shows that the Foal Eagle joint military drill is not an "annual one for self-defense", as touted by the U.S. and south Korea, but for preemptive nuclear attack on the DPRK.
					
					Over the past 50 odd years from 1961, the U.S. and south Korea have conducted DPRK-targeted war exercises of various forms for months through year, keying up the situation of the Korean Peninsula.
					
					All the facts prove that the U.S. and south Korean warmongers are the wreckers of peace of the Korean Peninsula.
					
					The DPRK is quite different from Iraq and Afghanistan. If the U.S. and south Korean warmongers finally ignite a nuclear war, the DPRK will deal a merciless nuclear blow to them.

articles.title: Japan's Crimes in Imjin Patriotic War
articles.content:
Japan's Crimes in Imjin Patriotic War
Pyongyang, April 13 (KCNA) -- The Imjin Patriotic War (1592-1598) was one of the wars fought by the Korean people against the Japanese aggressors.
					On April 13, 1592, Japan began invading Korea with mobilization of some 158 700 ground troops and tens of thousands of seamen. 
					
					Upon landing on Korea, the samurais of Japan ran wild in slaughtering inhabitants and plundering their properties. They went the lengths of cutting off people's ears and noses to ship them to Japan.
					
					According to historical data, more than hundreds of thousands of Koreans were killed during the two rounds of the samurais' raids.
					
					The samurais took away Korean scholars, monks, medical men, painters, architects and other talents to Japan to force slavery labor upon them and whisked off women for "sexual slavery".
					
					The invaders destroyed royal palaces, schools, temples and houses and robbed tombs wherever they went and pillaged all kinds of national assets, including books, paintings, metal types, ceramics, sculptures of Buddha and bells. 
					
					Their acts were, indeed, the vandalism towards Korea's advanced culture.
					
					Japan lost the war in November 1598 by the nationwide resistance of the Korean people.
					
					Its crime-woven history can never be erased though many centuries have passed after the war.
					
					Still now, Japan remains unchanged in its ambition for overseas aggression. It is taking the lead in clamping sanctions on the DPRK over its satellite launch and underground nuclear test.
					
					The army and people of the DPRK are determined to settle accounts with Japan at all costs.

articles.title: Korean in Japan Convicted of Espionage during "Yusin" Dictatorship Declared Not Guilty
articles.content:
Korean in Japan Convicted of Espionage during "Yusin" Dictatorship Declared Not Guilty
Pyongyang, April 13 (KCNA) -- Ko Pyong Thaek, a Korean residing in Japan, was declared not guilty at the Supreme Court of south Korea on April 11. He was sentenced to a prison term on groundless charge of espionage during the past "yusin" dictatorship.
					The south Korean Central Intelligence Agency arrested Ko when he visited Jeju Island, his birthplace in 1974, and put him to torture and threatened him to wrest from him false confession that he gathered secrets and handed them over to the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan.
					
					After faking up the spying case, the south Korean puppet regime indicted him on charge of the violation of the "Security Law" and sentenced him to ten years in prison and ten years of suspension of qualifications.
					
					In this regard the victim demanded the court retry the case in 2011.
					
					The court declared him not guilty after recognizing that he was illegally arrested and investigated and the case was based on a false confession.

articles.title: Japanese Reactionaries' Discrimination against Koreans in Japan Protested
articles.content:
Japanese Reactionaries' Discrimination against Koreans in Japan Protested
Pyongyang, April 13 (KCNA) -- The Japanese reactionaries have become all the more base in their moves of discriminating against Koreans schools.
					The Machida City Education Committee of Tokyo Metropolis made a "decision" not to distribute warning apparatuses for preventing crimes to pupils of Korean schools though it handed them out to the freshmen of all primary schools in the city. The committee formally informed Nishi Tokyo Korean Primary School No. 2 of this on March 28.
					
					This has touched off a flurry of protest from Koreans in different parts of Japan and Japanese citizens.
					
					The city education committee was deluged with protest phones that numbered more than 500 till the morning of April 8 since the "decision" was made public.
					
					On April 5 the above-said school held an emergency press conference demanding the city education committee make an official apology and cancel the unreasonable discrimination step.
					
					At the press conference principal of the school Ri Jong Ae condemned the step as an unpardonable human rights abuse and a foolish act of threatening the life and security of children.
					
					The chairperson of the mothers' society lamented the discrimination the innocent children are exposed to.
					
					Japanese citizens in their speeches said intolerable is the city education committee's act of maltreating some schools, adding they feel shame as Japanese.
					
					Meanwhile, the delegates of the Liaison Council Opposing Exclusion of Korean Schools from Tuition-waiver Program for Senior High Schools and the Society of Machida Citizens for Supporting Korean Schools, civic organizations of Japan, and an honorary professor of Hitotsubashi University visited the city education committee and submitted letters of protest to it.
					
					Civic critic Ryoko Ozawa in a radio speech on April 5, referring to this issue, said: It is a clear ill-treatment. Children have nothing to do with politics.

articles.title: Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia Exhibition Held in China
articles.content:
Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia Exhibition Held in China
Pyongyang, April 13 (KCNA) -- A Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia exhibition took place in Dalian on April 3 and 4 to celebrate the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					In the foreground of the exhibition were hundreds of flowers praising the great men against the background of a large painting portraying Kimilsungia and Kimjongilia.
					
					On display there were photos showing diplomas and gold medals conferred on Kimilsungia and Kimjongilia at international festivals and pamphlets.
					
					Present at the opening ceremony of the exhibition were officials of a Dalian company and the Dalian City Flower Association and masses.
					
					Present there on invitation were officials of the DPRK consulate general in Shenyang and Koreans working in Dalian.
					
					Speeches were made at the ceremony. Then followed a congratulatory art performance.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Work Published in China
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Work Published in China
Pyongyang, April 13 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un's work "The Great Kim Il Sung Is the Eternal Leader of Our Party and People" was brought out in pamphlet by the Dandong Longshan Printing House in China on April 7.
					The work, published on April 20, Juche 101 (2012), clarifies the revolutionary exploits of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il in their lifetimes. It indicates tasks to firmly defend and eternally glorify their ideas and exploits.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Work Studied, Disseminated in Peru, Guinea
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Work Studied, Disseminated in Peru, Guinea
Pyongyang, April 13 (KCNA) -- A seminar and a reading session on the dear respected Kim Jong Un's works "The Great Kim Il Sung Is the Eternal Leader of Our Party and People" and "Let Us March Forward Dynamically towards Final Victory, Holding Higher the Banner of Songun" were held in Peru and Guinea on March 31 and April 1.
					Guillermo Alcazar Ribera, chairman of the Peruvian Group for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, said that it was a historic event of great significance in accomplishing the cause of immortalizing the leader that Marshal Kim Jong Un made public the work "The Great Kim Il Sung Is the Eternal Leader of Our Party and People".
					
					President Kim Il Sung is the sun of mankind who performed undying exploits to shine along with the century by devoting his life to the noble cause for the country and people, socialism and independence against imperialism, he noted, adding:
					
					Korean socialism is vigorously advancing under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Un who is invariably carrying forward the revolutionary cause of Juche and Songun pioneered by the President and developed by leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					Now the U.S. and its allies are getting frantic in their moves to invade the DPRK. However, the DPRK will achieve a final victory in the showdown with the aggressors thanks to the indomitable will and pluck of Marshal Kim Jong Un, commander of Mt. Paektu, and his invincible Songun leadership.
					
					The director of a company in Guinea said at a reading session that the DPRK has achieved victory in its struggle to protect the sovereignty in the showdown with the U.S. because the DPRK is pursuing the Songun politics.
					
					The nuclear deterrence of the DPRK is to cope with the aggression of the U.S., the director said, adding the DPRK will win victory after victory by dint of Songun.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Songun Leadership Feats Introduced by Foreign Newspapers
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Songun Leadership Feats Introduced by Foreign Newspapers
Pyongyang, April 13 (KCNA) -- Indonesian and Nigerian papers dedicated articles to the 20th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's election as chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK.
					The Indonesian paper Republika on April 3 said in an article titled "Chairman of the National Defence Commission Kim Jong Il":
					
					Kim Jong Il worked as chairman of the NDC shouldering upon himself the destiny of socialist Korea. In those historical days he defended socialism despite the unprecedented adversity and glorified the DPRK as an invincible political and military power no one dares provoke.
					
					He applied the Songun politics in all fields, providing a sure guarantee for defending the sovereignty of the country and triumphantly advancing the socialist cause in whatever trials and adversities.
					
					He fully consolidated the political and ideological position of the country and ushered in a new era of building a thriving nation.
					
					The Nigerian paper Nigerian Observer on March 24 said in an article titled "Defender of Socialism":
					
					He resolutely shattered the moves of the U.S.-led imperialist allied forces to stifle the DPRK late in the last century.
					
					With his inspection of the dwarf pine post, he provided an occasion of a turning point in enforcing the Songun politics in all fields and strengthened the Korean People's Army into an invincible revolutionary army.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Birth Anniversary Celebrated in Different Countries
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Birth Anniversary Celebrated in Different Countries
Pyongyang, April 13 (KCNA) -- Round-table talks and film shows took place in Peru, Myanmar, Indonesia, Cambodia and Thailand on the occasion of the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung from April 2 to 4.
					Korean films shown included "Kimilsungia".
					
					Tani Baler Lopera, international secretary of the Communist Party of Peru "Red Motherland", Yuri Castro Romero, secretary general of the Peruvian-Korean Institute of Culture and Friendship, and other speakers praised Kim Il Sung as an outstanding leader and distinguished thinker and theoretician who will always live in the hearts of the world revolutionaries and progressives.
					
					The general secretary of the Union Solidarity and Development Party of Myanmar noted that Kim Il Sung defeated U.S. and Japanese imperialism, built socialist Korea and turned the DPRK into the people's paradise and powerful country independent in politics, self-supporting in the economy and self-reliant in national defence.
					
					The director general of the Antri Miek Publishing House of Cambodia praised Kim Il Sung as a peerless statesman who founded the Juche idea, adding:
					
					Under his leadership the Korean people registered great achievements in building and defending the country.
					
					The director general sincerely wished the Korean people greater successes in building a thriving socialist nation under the leadership of the dear respected Marshal Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Exploits of Peerlessly Great Men Praised Abroad
articles.content:
Exploits of Peerlessly Great Men Praised Abroad
Pyongyang, April 13 (KCNA) -- Events took place in different countries on the occasions of the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung and the 20th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's election as chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK.
					Meetings, book and photo exhibitions and film shows were held in Switzerland, Nigeria and Guinea from Mar. 21 to Apr. 6.
					
					The participants at the film shows watched such Korean films as "Korean People's Army, Steel-Strong Ranks".
					
					The chairman of the Switzerland-Korea Committee at the meeting praised Kim Il Sung as peerlessly great man who devoted his all to the country, revolution and people's happiness, adding that Kim Jong Il's election as chairman of the DPRK NDC marked a historic event of great significance in accomplishing the revolutionary cause of Songun.
					
					He said that the DPRK is winning one victory after another in the confrontation with the imperialists as it is led by the dear respected Kim Jong Un, another great man identical to the great Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il. 
					
					The director of the Art and Cultural Council of the Ministry of Federal Capital Territory of Nigeria at the photo exhibition said that Kim Jong Il turned the DPRK into a political and ideological power in which people are united in single mind with his Songun revolutionary leadership.
					
					The chairman of the Group for the Study of the Juche Idea in Conakry, Guinea at the film show spoke highly of the exploits performed by Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il and Kim Jong Un.
					
					A message of greeting to Kim Jong Un was adopted at the event held in Switzerland.

articles.title: Important Days of DPRK Marked in Bangladesh
articles.content:
Important Days of DPRK Marked in Bangladesh
Pyongyang, April 13 (KCNA) -- Bangladeshi organizations brought out bulletins on the occasions of the 20th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's election as chairman of the National Defence Commission (NDC) of the DPRK and the 81st anniversary of the Korean People's Army (KPA).
					The Bangladesh Group for the Study of the Songun Policy in its bulletin "Invincible Korean People's Army" on Apr. 4 said:
					
					The KPA has won one victory after another in an acute confrontation with the U.S. and its followers, reliably guaranteeing the defence of the socialist system and the building of a thriving nation.
					
					The source of the enormous strength of the KPA lies in the people-centered and soldier-based outstanding Juche-oriented military idea and strategies founded by President Kim Il Sung.
					
					Thanks to Kim Jong Il's election as chairman of the NDC the DPRK could demonstrate its might as an invincible power, while dynamically advancing along the road of socialism despite the imperialists' moves to stifle it.
					
					The KPA's might has been displayed more powerfully now.
					
					The Bangladesh-Korea Friendship and Solidarity Committee in its bulletin "NDC Chairman Kim Jong Il" said:
					
					The days when Kim Jong Il worked as chairman of the NDC were a period of historic significance as he led the DPRK to demonstrate its might as an invincible political and military power.

articles.title: Day of Sun Celebrated Abroad
articles.content:
Day of Sun Celebrated Abroad
Pyongyang, April 13 (KCNA) -- Meetings took place on Apr. 2 and 6 by the Russian Association for the Study of the Juche Idea, the Romanian Workers' Association and the Iceland-DPRK Friendship and Culture Association to celebrate the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					Dmitri Kostenko, chairman of the Russian Association for the Study of the Juche Idea, praised Kim Il Sung, father of socialist Korea, as the genuine leader of the people, outstanding strategist who led to victory the struggle against imperialism and the U.S. and the great leader and extraordinary thinker and theoretician who provided a solid foundation for the building of a thriving nation.
					
					Daniel Dediu, chairman of the Romanian Workers' Association, said that Kim Il Sung was an ever-victorious and iron-willed brilliant commander who led to victory the arduous anti-Japanese armed struggle and brought about the beginning of a downhill turn for the U.S. imperialists.
					
					Jon Arni Halldorsson, general secretary of the Iceland-DPRK Friendship and Culture Association, said that Kim Il Sung, who embarked on the road of revolution in his early years, founded the immortal Juche idea and led to victory the Korean revolution, in reliance on the tremendous might of popular masses, adding that he worked hard to put an end to the history of the nation's division and achieve the country's independent and peaceful reunification.
					
					A message of greeting to the dear respected Kim Jong Un and a message of solidarity were adopted at the meeting in Romania.

articles.title: Nepalese, Japanese Personages Support DPRK Defending Independence, Justice
articles.content:
Nepalese, Japanese Personages Support DPRK Defending Independence, Justice
Pyongyang, April 13 (KCNA) -- Personages of Nepal and Japan issued statements in protest against the moves of the U.S. and its satellite forces to stifle the DPRK.
					The chief of the editing desk of the Rising Nepal on Apr. 6 expressed support for the Korean people in their struggle to oppose the U.S. imperialists' nuclear threat and defend the country's sovereignty.
					
					The U.S.-masterminded UN Security Council fabricated the "resolutions on sanctions" against the DPRK, while the U.S. and its followers have become evermore pronounced in their moves to ignite a war, he said, and went on:
					
					The U.S. imperialists are threatening the DPRK to bring it into submission but, on the contrary, their moves resulted in justifying the efforts made by the Korean people who are developing nukes for the sake of self-defence and peaceful purposes.
					
					Takashi Nada, representative of the Ehime Institute for Contemporary Korean Issue in Japan, on Mar. 28 said that the U.S. double-standards have pushed the situation on the Korean Peninsula to go beyond the danger line.
					
					The U.S. loudly speaks of the "provocation from the DPRK" while escalating the tension on the Korean Peninsula. This can never be pardoned, he held.
					
					Saying that the world conscience will accuse the U.S. of violating the sovereignty of the DPRK, he voiced support for peace-loving socialist Korea defending independence and justice.

articles.title: Special Statement of DPRK Government, Political Parties and Organizations Supported Abroad
articles.content:
Special Statement of DPRK Government, Political Parties and Organizations Supported Abroad
Pyongyang, April 13 (KCNA) -- A Peruvian political party and a German organization expressed support for the special statement issued by the government, political parties and organizations of the DPRK.
					The People's Front of Workers, Peasants and Students of Peru in a political statement on Apr. 4 supported the above-said statement denouncing the U.S. imperialists for their nuclear war exercises, adding:
					
					The Korean people have taken up a combat posture to suit to the state of war.
					
					We hope that the DPRK will keep launching satellites to cope with the U.S. hostile policy toward it.
					
					We urge the U.S. Yankees to pull out of south Korea and not to deter the DPRK from its economic and cultural development.
					
					The Anti-Imperialist Forum of Germany in its statement on Apr. 6 said:
					
					The U.S. imperialists introduced various kinds of preemptive nuclear strike means into south Korea, creating a touch-and-go situation on the Korean Peninsula where a war may break out any moment.
					
					The Strategic Rocket Force of the Korean People's Army was ordered to get ready to mount a preemptive attack on the U.S. imperialist military bases any moment to cope with the situation where the country's sovereignty has been wantonly threatened.
					
					We extend full support to the Korean people in their heroic struggle to defend the country's sovereignty and the nations' dignity.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un envia fondos de asistencia escolar y becas a los hijos de coreanos en Japon
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un envia fondos de asistencia escolar y becas a los hijos de coreanos en Japon
Pyongyang, 13 de abril (ACNC) -- En ocasion del 101o aniversario de natalicio del Presidente Kim Il Sung, el Mariscal Kim Jong Un envio 198 millones 300 mil ï¿¥ (moneda japonesa) como fondos de asistencia escolar y becas para el desarrollo de la educacion nacional democratica para los hijos de los coreanos residentes en Japon.
					Con esa suma ascienden a 47 mil 123 millones 350 mil 390 ï¿¥ los fondos enviados por ese concepto en 159 ocasiones por el Presidente, el Dirigente Kim Jong Il y el Mariscal.

articles.title: Autoridades surcoreanas deben tomar seriamente la medida importante de RPDC
articles.content:
Autoridades surcoreanas deben tomar seriamente la medida importante de RPDC
Pyongyang, 13 de abril (ACNC) -- Insatisfechas de haber agravado con EE.UU. la tension militar de la Peninsula Coreana, las fuerzas conservadoras surcoreanas tratan ahora de convertir la Zona Industrial de Kaesong (ZIK), fruto de la epoca del 15 de junio, en un escenario de confrontacion.
					El connotado elemento conflictivo Kim Kwan Jin, ministro de Defensa Nacional, expuso su siniestra intencion de introducir en dicha zona los comandos norteamericanos bajo el rotulo de la operacion de "rescate de rehenes".
					
					Al respecto, la RPDC declaro el dia 8 la importante medida de retirar sus empleados de la ZIK y la suspension temporal de la operacion de la misma.
					
					Pese a la justeza de esa medida, los maniacos de guerra dicen unas tonterias para librarse de la responsabilidad de la situacion y hasta la inquilina de Chongwadae tergiversa los hechos con sus discursos cinicos.
					
					La ZIK fue construida como simbolo de reconciliacion, cooperacion y reunificacion gracias a que la RPDC concedio prerrogativas a un empresario surcoreano apreciando su proposito patriotico a favor de reunificacion.
					
					De esa manera, se ha preparado la firme base que garantiza el interes y la prosperidad comunes del Norte y el Sur de Corea en el dominio economico, al darse a numerosas empresas surcoreanas la oportunidad de montar negocios en la ZIK.
					
					Los medios de prensa surcoreanos y hasta las fuentes extranjeras evaluaron que la "construccion de la ZIK es el mejor fruto del intercambio y cooperacion intercoreanos" (MBC) y que "se ha hecho la historia de perforar la fortificada zona desmilitarizada entre el Norte y el Sur de Corea" (Los Angeles Times).
					
					Aunque surgieron varias veces los problemas complicados en la gestion de la ZIK durante 4 anos de mandato del traidor Lee, la RPDC se mostro paciente y magnanima para el desarrollo y la activacion de esa zona. Tal actitud partio de la decision patriotica y la noble fraternidad para acelerar la cooperacion y el intercambio intercoreanos a base del ideal "Entre nosotros, los connacionales" y el desarrollo equilibrado de la economia nacional.
					
					Pero, burlando los esfuerzos sinceros de la RPDC, Lee Myung Bak freno la operacion de la ZIK diciendo que la cooperacion en ella es el "camino util solo para el Norte".
					
					Frustro sistematicamente los proyectos de cooperacion en la zona describiendolos como "entrega unilateral" al Norte y chismeando que es "imposible mejorar las relaciones intercoreanas con la cooperacion".
					
					Las actuales fuerzas conservadoras tambien intentan convertir la ZIK en el foco de guerra insultado a la RPDC que concedio a la parte Sur hasta esa zona militarmente estrategica.
					
					La ciudadana de Pyongyang Ri Song Hwa (45 anos de edad) dijo que la actual gobernante surcoreana debe tomar una "opcion correcta", y prosiguio:
					
					La existencia y el cierre de la zona depende enteramente de las autoridades surcoreanas que causaron la situacion actual.
					
					La actual inquilina de Chongwadae debe tomar seriamente la importante medida de la RPDC.

articles.title: Responsabilidad de la tension de Peninsula Coreana recae sobre EE.UU., insiste ACNC
articles.content:
Responsabilidad de la tension de Peninsula Coreana recae sobre EE.UU., insiste ACNC
Pyongyang, 13 de abril (ACNC) -- Los belicistas estadounidenses enviaron a la zona maritima cercana a la Peninsula Coreana los dos portaaviones nucleares supertamanos Nimitz y Stennis hablando de la supuesta "provocacion" de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y volvio a infiltrar el submarino nuclear Cheyenne en la zona maritima alrededor de la misma Peninsula, fomentando al maximo el ambiente de guerra. 
					EE.UU. viene recurriendo durante varios decenios a los ejercicios de guerra nuclear contra la RPDC. Pero, es la primera vez que moviliza los medios de ataque nuclear de todos tipos a la campana de aplastamiento a la RPDC. 
					
					La realidad demuestra que los tejemanejes de EE.UU. tendentes a desatar la guerra nuclear en la Peninsula Coreana entran en etapa aventurera.
					
					Debido a tal campana de guerra nuclear de EE.UU., la situacion de la region se halla en la fase peor.
					
					La responsabilidad de la tension actual de la Peninsula Coreana recae enteramente sobre Estados Unidos.
					
					El imperio yanqui se desespera para lograr de todos modos el desarme nuclear de la RPDC considerando que la fuerte capacidad militar de ella acabara con su politica hostil que posibilita el cumplimiento de la estrategia de hegemonia mundial.
					
					En este contexto, fabrico las "resoluciones de sancion" de la ONU cuestionado el lanzamiento de satelite y la tercera prueba nuclear subterranea de la RPDC realizados en diciembre del ano pasado y en febrero del ano en curso, respectivamente, y desarrolla con frenesi los ejercicios de guerra nuclear de gran envergadura sin precedente. 
					
					Trazo junto con los titeres surcoreanos el "plan de operaciones conjuntas para hacer frente a la provocacion local" no ocultando su intento de extender la provocacion del ejercito titere a la guerra total nuclear contra la RPDC bajo la injerencia de sus tropas. 
					
					Llega al climax en su brutalidad la campana anti-RPDC que libra EE.UU. movilizando toda su capacidad politica, economica y militar. 
					
					Tales hechos evidencian que EE.UU. es el responsable de la tension tirante de la Peninsula Coreana. 
					
					Pese a ello, intenta imponer a la RPDC la responsabilidad del caso con el fin de ejercerle la presion internacional y justificar su brutal politica hostil a la RPDC. 
					
					Pero, no puede doblegar con nada la decision antiyanqui del ejercito y pueblo coreanos. 
					
					Son justas las superintransigentes contramedidas de autodefensa de la RPDC tomadas frente a los actos hostiles de EE.UU. que perturba la paz y estabilidad de la region y es cierto el triunfo de la primera. 
					
					El ejercito y pueblo de la RPDC continuaran con intransigencia la batalla antiyanqui para eliminar completamente la brutal politica hostil a la RPDC del imperio norteamericano.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun denuncia ejercicio artillero conjunto en Sur de Corea
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun denuncia ejercicio artillero conjunto en Sur de Corea
Pyongyang, 13 de abril (ACNC) -- El dia 9, los belicistas surcoreanos perpetraron en la costa oriental de la provincia de Kangwon del Sur de Corea el entrenamiento artillero conjunto de gran envergadura contra la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea movilizando numerosos pertrechos belicos de las fuerzas terrestres, aereas y navales, tales como los canones autopropulsados K-9, los lanzacohetes reactivos, los radares anti-artilleria, los destructores y KF-16 y F-15K.
					En un comentario individual insertado hoy, el diario Rodong Sinmun revelo que agrava mas la tension esa maniobra encaminada a acatar de manera tridimensional a la RPDC y realizada coincidiendo con el entrenamiento Foal Eagle en el suelo surcoreano.
					
					Ahora la situacion de la Peninsula Coreana se torna mas peligrosa y tensa que nunca, senala el diario y prosigue:
					
					Tomando el actual estado creado en la peninsula como buena oportunidad para lograr su ambicion de agredir al Norte, los titeres surcoreanos desarrollan diariamente los ejercicios de guerra en confabulacion con su amo yanqui.
					
					Como de siempre, ellos utilizaron esta vez tambien el pretexto de hacer frente a la supuesta "provocacion del Norte".
					
					Dado que el estallido de guerra nuclear en la Peninsula Coreana se hace hecho consumado por la culpa de EE.UU. y los titeres surcoreanos, es natural que la RPDC pase a las acciones militares practicas para frustrar tajantemente las brutales campanas agresivas en su contra movilizando generalmente su disuasivo de autodefensa.
					
					No habra piedad en la guerra total para dar punto final a la imprudente amenaza militar y las maniobras agresivas de EE.UU. y los titeres, defender firmemente la soberania y la maxima dignidad del pais y cumplir el historico deseo de reunificar la patria.
					
					Si los enemigos se atreven a atentar contra la RPDC, no se hara esperar el poderoso ataque nuclear de la RPDC que reducira lo todo a cenizas y escombros.
